required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of ApneaLink Plus Scoring Capabilities
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of ApneaLink Plus Scoring Capabilities

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to investigate the following topics:
- Determine the accuracy of ApneaLink Plus in separating Apneas into Obstructive Apneas, Mixed Apneas and Central Apneas.
- Determine the accuracy of ApneaLink Plus in scoring Hypopneas according to the 2008 guidelines of the AASM = American Academy of Sleep Medcine.
- Determine whether patients can start and stop the recorder and are able to attach the additional effort sensor by themselves using the patient instruction sheet

detailed_description.textblock:
- Determine the accuracy of ApneaLink Plus in separating Apneas into Obstructive Apneas, Mixed Apneas and Central Apneas.
- Determine the accuracy of ApneaLink Plus in scoring Hypopneas according to the 2008 guidelines of the AASM = American Academy of Sleep Medcine.
- Determine whether patients can start and stop the recorder and are able to attach the additional effort sensor by themselves using the patient instruction sheet

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the Apnoea-Hypopnea-Index (Number of Apneas (All Apneas, Obstructive, Mixed, Central) and Number of Hypopneas) Between ApneaLink Plus and a PSG System Within the Same Evaluation Period
primary_outcome.description: Apnoea is defined as a decrease in flow of ≥90% from baseline for at least 10 seconds; hypopnea is a decrease in flow ≥30% from baseline for at least 10 seconds and an oxygen desaturation of ≥4%; obstructive: breathing efforts are ongoing; central: no breathing efforts

The AHI (PSG) values and AHI ApneaLink Plus (AL) value will be collected in one graph (Bland-Altmann Plot) and the correlation coefficient will be calculated. A correlation of >75% will be seen as threshold for validity.

The AI (PSG) values and AI ApneaLink Plus (AL) value will be collected in one graph (Bland-Altmann Plot) and the correlation coefficient will be calculated. A correlation of >75% will be seen as threshold for validity.

The OAI (PSG) values and OAI ApneaLink Plus (AL) value will be collected in one graph (Bland-Altmann Plot) and the correlation coefficient will be calculated. A correlation of >75% will be seen as threshold for validity.

The CAI (PSG) values and CAI ApneaLink Plus (AL) value will be collected in one graph (Bland-Altmann Plot) and the correlation coefficient will be calculated. A correlation of >75% will be seen as threshold for validity.

The HI (PSG) values and HI ApneaLink Plus (AL) value will be collected in one graph (Bland-Altmann Plot) and the correlation coefficient will be calculated. A correlation of >75% will be seen as threshold for validity.

The ODI (PSG) values and ODI ApneaLink Plus (AL) value will be collected in one graph (Bland-Altmann Plot) and the correlation coefficient will be calculated. A correlation of >75% will be seen as threshold for validity.

arm_group.description: Participant wears an Apnea Link sleep apnoea screening device during the polysomnography to detect apnoeas (obstructive, central).

intervention.description: Device used to evaluate for the presence of obstructive, central or mixed apneas

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Willing to give written informed consent
- Adult patients who are 18 years of age or older
- No alcohol consumption 12 hrs before and during the trial period
- Normally sleep more than 3 hours per night
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to comprehend written and spoken German.
- Pregnant
- Patients who use of Bilevel PAP or CPAP therapy during the PSG
- Unsuitable for inclusion in the opinion of the investigator

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Assessment of the Apnoea-Hypopnea-Index (Number of Apneas (All Apneas, Obstructive, Mixed, Central) and Number of Hypopneas) Between ApneaLink Plus and a PSG System Within the Same Evaluation Period
outcome.description: Apnoea is defined as a decrease in flow of ≥90% from baseline for at least 10 seconds; hypopnea is a decrease in flow ≥30% from baseline for at least 10 seconds and an oxygen desaturation of ≥4%; obstructive: breathing efforts are ongoing; central: no breathing efforts

group.title: PSG/ApneaLink
group.description: Sleep Evaluation under Polysomnography and with ApneaLink

measure.title: Assessment of the Apnoea-Hypopnea-Index (Number of Apneas (All Apneas, Obstructive, Mixed, Central) and Number of Hypopneas) Between ApneaLink Plus and a PSG System Within the Same Evaluation Period
measure.description: Apnoea is defined as a decrease in flow of ≥90% from baseline for at least 10 seconds; hypopnea is a decrease in flow ≥30% from baseline for at least 10 seconds and an oxygen desaturation of ≥4%; obstructive: breathing efforts are ongoing; central: no breathing efforts

outcome.title: Correlation Coefficient of Apnoea-Hypopnea-Index (AHI) (PSG) - AHI (AL)
outcome.description: The AHI (PSG) values and AHI ApneaLink Plus (AL) value will be collected in one graph (Bland-Altmann Plot) and the correlation coefficient will be calculated. A correlation of >75% will be seen as threshold for validity.
outcome.population: Participant undergoes one night of sleep while wearing an Apnea Link device and polysomnography is being recorded.

group.title: AL + Polysomnography
group.description: Participant wears an Apnea Link sleep apnoea screening device during the polysomnography to detect apnoeas (obstructive, central). ApneaLink Plus: Device used to evaluate for the presence of obstructive, central or mixed apneas

measure.title: Correlation Coefficient of Apnoea-Hypopnea-Index (AHI) (PSG) - AHI (AL)
measure.description: The AHI (PSG) values and AHI ApneaLink Plus (AL) value will be collected in one graph (Bland-Altmann Plot) and the correlation coefficient will be calculated. A correlation of >75% will be seen as threshold for validity.
measure.population: Participant undergoes one night of sleep while wearing an Apnea Link device and polysomnography is being recorded.

analysis.groups_desc: Per recording, the number of events found per category with PSG and ApneaLink Plus will be compared. As a summary, all PSG values and all ApneaLink Plus values per category will be collected in one graph (Bland-Altmann Plot). The correlation coefficient will be calculated per category. A correlation of >75% will be seen as threshold for validity.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The number of events found per category (PSG and ApneaLink Plus recording) will be compared. Events are Apneas and Hypopneas per hour of sleep, measured as Apnea-Hypopnea-Index (AHI), Apnea-Index (AI), Obstructive AI, Central AI, Hypopnea-Index (HI) and Oxygen Desaturation Index (ODI).

outcome.title: Correlation Coefficient of Apnoea-Index (AI) (PSG) - AI (AL)
outcome.description: The AI (PSG) values and AI ApneaLink Plus (AL) value will be collected in one graph (Bland-Altmann Plot) and the correlation coefficient will be calculated. A correlation of >75% will be seen as threshold for validity.
outcome.population: Participant undergoes one night of sleep while wearing an Apnea Link device and polysomnography is being recorded.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
